title: Ukraine Strikes Makiivka, Igniting a Huge Blast in Russian-Occupied City
description: Ukrainian and Russian officials differed on whether a military or civilian area had been struck. Earlier in the war, Russia lost dozens of soldiers, if not hundreds, in a strike on the city.

title: Your Thursday Briefing: Israel’s West Bank Raid Ends
description: Also, fatal floods in China and other Asian countries.

title: Tourist Seen Defacing Rome’s Colosseum Says He Didn’t Know It Was Ancient
description: A man who etched his initials and those of his girlfriend in a wall of the nearly 2,000-year-old monument wrote a letter of apology, and his lawyer says he is hoping for a plea bargain.

title: Did Israel’s Military Incursion in the West Bank Solve Anything?
description: Israelis and Palestinians said the armed groups that were the targets of the military raid would quickly rebuild and the Israeli soldiers would be back soon.

title: Four Countries Sue for Answers Over Airline Downed by Iran’s Missiles
description: In 2020, Iranian missiles struck a Ukraine Airlines flight, killing all 176 people on board. Four countries have filed suit in The Hague demanding a credible account and full compensation.

title: Biden and the Swedish prime minister meet to discuss Sweden’s NATO bid.
In an Ambivalent Scotland, a Second Coronation for Charles
description: While this one was purely ceremonial, it offered the king a chance to mend fences with a nation that is not hugely enamored of him or the monarchy.

title: When Did the U.S. Become a Democracy?
description: Until fairly recently, that would have seemed like a peculiar question. But many experts on American history and political science say U.S. democracy is relatively young.

title: Elizabeth Tsurkov Held for Months in Iraq by Militia Linked to Iran
description: Elizabeth Tsurkov, an Israeli researcher, was seized in late March by an Iraqi Shiite group shortly after leaving a Baghdad cafe, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said.

title: German Government Slashes Spending, Except on the Military
description: The proposed package foresees spending about 6 percent less in 2024 from this year, in a return to financial austerity. But the severity of the cuts to social services drew sharp criticism.

title: After China Arrested Her Husband, A Wife Discovered His Secret Dissident Blog
description: He was brilliant, quirky and intensely private — and also, she now suspects, an anonymous dissident blogger who had won fame for years of evading the surveillance state.

title: Tensions Surge Around Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Plant
description: Ukraine and Russia accused each other of plotting attacks at the facility, though some analysts have said that the immediate risks to the plant remained low.

title: Social Class Is Not About Only Race
description: Class diversity has been a blind spot for many colleges. Will that now change?

title: China Reels From Floods and a Bruising Heat Wave
description: Heavy rains and heat waves have affected parts of China and the Asia Pacific region this week. More of the same was in the forecast.

title: ‘Don’t Be Sad, Father’: Farewells Reflect Deadly Period in West Bank
description: In one of the deadliest periods in years in the Israeli-occupied West Bank, young Palestinians drawn into the struggle against Israel are writing farewell messages to their loved ones.

title: A Captured Russian Soldier’s Story: ‘They Just Sent Us to Die’
description: An inmate hoped to start over with a clean slate by fighting in Ukraine. Instead, he was confronted by the drudgery of trench work and the terror of battle. “You’re going in as meat,” he said he was told.

title: Rabbi’s Brush With Danger in Ukraine Went Viral
description: A video put a fresh spotlight on the chief rabbi of Ukraine, whose renown predates his humanitarian efforts since Russia’s full-scale invasion.

title: That North Korean Rocket That Set Off Panic In Seoul? It Was a Dud.
description: After analyzing debris from the North’s recently failed rocket launch, South Korea concluded that the isolated country’s satellite technology was useless.

title: Israel Pulls Out of Jenin in West Bank
description: The major military incursion into the Palestinian city of Jenin left at least 12 Palestinians and one Israeli soldier dead, while an assault on civilians in Tel Aviv wounded at least eight.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: An outburst of tit-for-tat violence in Israel and the West Bank.
